article.headline: Maine 89, Harvard 78
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Kevin Reed scored a career-high 36 points, including 24 in the first half, to lead Maine to a 89-78 victory over Harvard on Tuesday night. Maine (4-1) used a 13-0 run, highlighted by six points from Reed, in the first half to open up a 57-40 lead at the break. The Black Bears led by as many as 20 points, 51-31, after Freddy Petkus' 3-pointer. Harvard (0-4) trailed by double digits for most of the contest, but cut Maine's lead to six points, 82-76, on Jason Norman's basket with 2:24 remaining. Reed hit four of his six 3-pointers in the first half. Mark Flavin added 12 points and Eric Dobson had 12 points and eight assists for Maine. Matt Stehle had a career-high 20 points and 10 rebounds to lead the Crimson, whose 0-4 start is its worst since the 1991-92 season when it began the season 0-11. The Crimson have lost six straight dating back to last season. Kevin Rogus had 22 points and Michael Beal and Norman each added 10 for Harvard.
